intro: Silaus silaus, commonly known as the common silaus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Silaus silaus plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in agricultural settings.
